webswe.title: Software Engineer, Full Stack
desc: Assumed a lead role on a product at its MVP phase, managing its JIRA, tasking team members, and completely rebuilding the front end from scratch with multiple additional features, such as messaging, user authentication and registration, and hybrid vanilla+SVG rendering.
Develop frontend and backend features and improvements for web applications using Vue.js, Node.js, and Redis.
Create JavaScript processes to observe and transform data in Redis for consumption by other components.
Optimize application performance by rewriting data structures, Vue components, data flows, and legacy code.

automationswe.title: Software Engineer, Automation
desc: Supported team as acting lead during a period of transition between managers (January to July 2021).
Fully automated the UI regression tests of our primary web application using Python, TestComplete, and Selenium.
Created automation scripts for Windows applications and processes using Python and Batch scripting.
Modernized the main UI of a Vue application in a team of three, handling the layout and all CSS styles.

ste.title: Software Test Automation Engineer
desc: Promoted from Systems Analyst for prototyping our first automated regression tests, kickstarting a new team.
Wrote automated UI and scenario tests using Python and Selenium.

Evaluated off-the-shelf test automation frameworks, successfully presented a build-vs-buy case to senior management, and migrated over existing test functionality, reducing our project timeline by one year.

satw.title: Systems Analyst
desc: Designed and developed a standalone Python tool with GUI controls to automate our Confluence document export process, reducing a four hour task to a single click.
Wrote user guides and help system content, tested new builds, and submitted bug reports and improvements.
Wrote multiple sections of our style guide (chiefly voice and tone) which are still used for all documentation.

st.title: Software Application Tester
desc: Tested web-based logistics applications, tracked requirements, and wrote test suites, test cases, and bug reports.
Acted as lead tester and issue tracker for a major functional area of our application during a redesign from Flash to HTML5.
Wrote reference docs, training material, and user guides for developers, testers, and customers.

editor.title: Localization Editor
desc: Worked closely with a translator to localize around half of a Nintendo Switch visual novel, amounting to over 400,000 Japanese characters.

editor.title: Localization Editor
desc: Edit translated comedy manga for digital and physical publication with a strong bias for puns and alliteration.

editor.title: Localization Editor
desc: Work closely with translators to produce localized novels and manga for digital and physical publication, modifying, rewriting, or retranslating content where appropriate.
Promoted to editor as the top pick from the candidate pool of proofreaders.

proofreader.title: Proofreader
desc: Proofread novels and manga from other translation teams on an as-needed basis.

editor.title: Localization Editor & Backup Translator
desc: Editing the 25 volume backlog of a Shogakukan manga series.
Acting as backup translator for currently-releasing weekly chapters.

tlpr.title: Translator & Editor
desc: Checked the accuracy of English translations by comparing them against their original texts, adjusting characterization and phrasing as needed.
Translated Japanese to English and work with proofreaders to finalize content.
Coordinated small teams on multiple projects simultaneously, mentoring other proofreaders and ESL team members.

interpreter.title: Interpreter
desc: Acted as a private interpreter for Ernst Law Group during depositions with German legal teams.
Translated technical engineering and manufacturing documents in a high-speed environment.

localization editor.title: Localization Editor
desc: Proofread, edited, and/or translated over 36,000 lines of text from English to German.
Moderated an online team of 20 volunteer translators and represented inXile Entertainment in mediating discussions within this group.
Tested weekly software builds for localization issues and modified text mappings as needed.

ucsb.name: University of California, Santa Barbara
ucsb.desc: Studied the mixed bag of language, logic, psychology, respiratory anatomy, anthropology, and education theory that is linguistics.

icu.name: International Christian University
icu.desc: Took courses in Japanese political science, language policy, sociology, and culture. Completed an academic internship teaching English.

cuesta.name: Cuesta College
cuesta.desc: Took the core computer science series and the AWS Developer Associate course. Studied Java, data structures and algorithms, and object oriented programming.
